_header: Now all men may seen by me
Subjects: death; vanity, against worldly; women, as speakers/narrators; sermons, verse in

WorcF10.First Lines:
Now all men mowe sen be meThat wordys Ioye is
                    vanyte…
WorcF10.Last Lines:
…Only þo xuln abyde wit meAl ouer [sic] thynges
                    arn wanyte
WorcF10.Editions:
Owst,  Gerald Robert. 
             Literature and Pulpit in Medieval England.
         Cambridge: UP, 1933: 530.
Woolf,  Rosemary. 
             The English Religious Lyric in the Middle Ages.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1968: 316-17.
